channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Asian Stocks Rise as Trade Tensions Ebb, Gold Dips: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian shares rose for the first time in four days, putting a regional gauge close to levels last seen in October as trade tensions continue to tamp down.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy

item.title: Australia Cuts Key Rate, Retains Cautious Stance on Global Risks
item.description: Australia’s central bank lowered its key interest rate for a second time this year, while remaining cautious on the policy outlook against a backdrop of heightened global uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Swati Pandey

item.title: RBA Sees Unemployment Rise to Near 6% in a ‘Trade War’ Scenario
item.description: Australia’s central bank warned that the unemployment rate would climb to nearly 6% in a “trade war” scenario where the US re-imposes higher ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs in 2026 and all countries retaliate.
item.dc:creator: Swati Pandey

item.title: Japan’s 20-Year Bond Auction Gets Weakest Demand Since 2012
item.description: Japan’s auction of 20-year bonds got the lowest demand since 2012, pointing to market concern about who will buy as the Bank of Japan dials back its huge debt holdings.
item.dc:creator: Ayai Tomisawa, Mia Glass

item.title: Gold Falls as Haven Demand From Moody’s Downgrade Fades
item.description: Gold fell as the haven-demand boost from Moody’s Ratings downgrade of the US faded, and attention turned back to the easing of trade tensions between the two largest economies.
item.dc:creator: Yihui Xie

item.title: Saudi Berries Among Egyptian Private Equity Fund’s Investments
item.description: Growing berries in Saudi Arabia and a farming project by the Nile are among the first investments of a new private equity firm co-founded by the former chief of Egypt’s sovereign wealth fund.
item.dc:creator: Mirette Magdy

media:content.media:description: Saudi Arabia aims to localize 85% of its food industry by 2030.

item.title: EV Battery Maker CATL Surges in Hong Kong Trading Debut
item.description: Shares in CATL jumped as much as 14% on Tuesday as the Chinese EV battery giant made its trading debut in Hong Kong. The world’s biggest listing this year raised $4.6 billion despite being blacklisted by the Pentagon and grinding through geopolitical storms. Bloomberg's Yvonne Man reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oil Steadies as Trump Retreats From Ukraine-Russia Peace Talks
item.description: Oil was steady after a two-day gain, as the market digested signs that US President Donald Trump is pulling back from his efforts to end the war between Ukraine and Russia.
item.dc:creator: Yongchang Chin

item.title: Cathie Wood Buys Most TSMC Depositary Receipts in Nearly a Year
item.description: Cathie Wood’s funds made their biggest purchase of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. shares in nearly a year, underscoring a change in stance from being mostly sellers of the chipmaker since the third quarter of last year.
item.dc:creator: Abhishek Vishnoi

item.title: US Equities Can Live With Higher Rates: Analyst
item.description: Continued elevated interest rates as the Fed adopts a wait-and-see approach may be "not such a bad thing", NF Trinity Managing Partner & CIO Helen Zhu tells Bloomberg. Zhu adds the bigger challenge would be if rate cuts signal a weakening of the domestic economy. She speaks after two Federal Reserve officials, including New York Fed chief John Williams, suggested policymakers may not be ready to lower interest rates before September as they confront a murky economic outlook. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CATL Rises in HK Debut After World’s Top Listing This Year
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. rose in its Hong Kong trading debut after the Chinese battery giant wrapped up the world’s biggest listing this year by raising HK$35.7 billion ($4.6 billion) despite being blacklisted by the Pentagon and grinding through geopolitical storms.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: CATL Chairman Robin Zeng strikes a gong at the listing ceremony in Hong Kong. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

item.title: Wells Fargo Says to Buy US Stocks and Cut EM After Strong Rally
item.description: Investors should reduce their holdings of emerging market equities and buy US stocks instead, according to Wells Fargo & Co.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Bosley

item.title: Trump Approves Final Permit for Perpetua’s US Gold-Antimony Mine
item.description: The Trump administration has granted the final federal permit for a gold mine being developed by Perpetua Resources Corp., which also has a reserve of antimony, a critical mineral used in munitions.
item.dc:creator: Ari Natter

item.title: China Banks Cut Deposit Rates to Aid Margins, Drive Spending
item.description: Major Chinese banks cut deposit rates again, in the latest efforts to preserve their shrinking profitability and drive consumers to spend more amid a flagging economy.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu

item.title: Toyota Industries Shares Up on Report It Will Accept Buyout Bid
item.description: Shares of Toyota Industries Corp. surged as much as 9%, the most since April 28, after a report that the firm is set to accept a buyout offer from Akio Toyoda, chair of Toyota Motor Corp.
item.dc:creator: Alice French

item.title: India’s Dirty Furnaces Threaten Global Steel Net Zero Goal
item.description: India’s steel sector could make or break a key global decarbonization objective, according to a non-profit that tracks energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Katharine Gemmell

item.title: Top Vietnam Steelmaker Says Local Building Boom Will Fuel Growth
item.description: Vietnam’s top steelmaker Hoa Phat Group is counting on the nation’s rising economic growth and massive infrastructure projects from railways to seaports to fuel the company’s expansion and cushion any fallout from US tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Giang Nguyen

media:content.media:description: Hot steel slabs on a rolling line inside the Hoa Phat Dung Quat Complex in Quang Ngai province, Vietnam, on May 16.

item.title: Matt Markiewicz on Tradr 2X Long QBTS Daily ETF (QBTX)
item.description: Tradr ETFs Head of Product and Capital Markets Matt Markiewicz discusses the Tradr 2X Long QBTS Daily ETF (ticker: QBTX) in an interview with Scarlet Fu and Eric Balchunas on “ETF IQ.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: GLS CEO on How Tariffs Are Spurring Onshoring Resurgence
item.description: Global Location Strategies President and CEO Didi Caldwell discusses the resurgence of onshoring amid the Trump administration's tariffs on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Erases 1% Slide as Dip Buyers Wade Back In | Bloomberg: The Close 05/19/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Mike Contopoulos, Richard Bernstein, Mike McKee, Bloomberg News, Stephanie Kelton, Stony Brook University, Didi Caldwell, Global Location Strategies, Sridhar Natarajan, Bloomberg News, Tony DeSpirito, BlackRock, Stephen Parker, JPMorgan & Grace Peters, JPMorgan, David Gitlin, Carrier, Sarah Bianchi, Evercore ISI, Jaewon Kang, Bloomberg News. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Moody's US Downgrade Not a Surprise: Stony Brook's Kelton
item.description: Stephanie Kelton, Stony Brook University professor of public policy and economics, discusses the Moody's downgrade of the US sovereign credit rating on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: China Pivot, Sweden's Innovation Engine, US Army Secretary Driscoll | Wall Street Week
item.description: This week, former US Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Hoover Institution's Elizabeth Economy discuss the US pivot on trade dealings with China. Plus, a look at Sweden’s vibrant capital markets and Nasdaq's role in its innovation ecosystem. Later, US Army Secretary Driscoll joins us with the administration's approach to a decades-long spending challenge at the Pentagon. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Vanke Bond’s 144% Rally Shows Credit Strain Easing After Rescue
item.description: Financial strains are easing at China Vanke Co. after its largest state shareholder threw a lifeline to the company that proved too big to fail.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Emma Dong

media:content.media:description: Residential buildings under construction at the China Vanke Co. Isle Maison development in Shanghai, China, on Friday, Jan. 17, 2025. Concerns over China Vanke spiked amid questions on the latest status of its top executive and a local news report that the property developer may be seized by state authorities.

item.title: Theft of Coinbase Customer Data Probed by Justice Department
item.description: The US Justice Department has opened a probe into a recent breach at the leading cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Global Inc., according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Chris Strohm, Jeff Stone

media:content.media:description: Monitors display Coinbase signage during the company's initial public offering (IPO) at the Nasdaq MarketSite in New York, U.S., on Wednesday, April 14, 2021. Coinbase Global Inc., the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange, is set to debut on Wednesday through a direct listing, an alternative to a traditional initial public offering that has only been deployed a handful of times. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Nippon Steel Boosts Investment for Proposed US Steel Deal
item.description: Nippon Steel Corp. has bolstered its pledge to invest in United States Steel Corp. in the event that President Donald Trump approves the Japanese company’s proposed $14.1 billion takeover, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Joe Deaux

media:content.media:description: The United States Steel Corp. Clairton Coke Works facility in Clairton, Pennsylvania, US, on Monday, Sept. 9, 2024. United States Steel Corp. faces the prospect of being broken apart and sold in parts if Nippon Steel Corp.'s $14.1 billion takeover fails.

item.title: Carrier CEO Gitlin on Data Centers, US Hiring Plans
item.description: Carrier Chair and CEO David Gitlin discusses the company's data center business and plans to invest $1 billion to grow US manufacturing on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Royal Caribbean Sheds Junk-Debt Status After Moody’s Upgrade
item.description: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. regained its investment-grade status on Monday, as Moody’s Ratings matched the upgrade that S&P Global Ratings made three months ago.
item.dc:creator: Caleb Mutua, Redd Brown

media:content.media:description: The Royal Caribbean Wonder of the Seas cruise ship docked in Nassau, Bahamas, on Monday, April 29, 2024. Cruise lines have spent at least $1.5 billion since 2019 to expand or improve private stops in the Caribbean, according to Bloomberg calculations.

item.title: S&P 500 Erases 1% Slide as Dip Buyers Wade Back In: Markets Wrap
item.description: A renewed wave of dip buying fueled a rebound in stocks, with traders looking past the US credit downgrade by Moody’s Ratings that had earlier sent bond yields jumping. The dollar fell.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Emerging FX Jumps as Moody’s Downgrade Undermines the Dollar
item.description: An index for emerging-market currencies advanced on Monday as the greenback fell following Moody’s Ratings downgrade of US government debt, while lawmakers in Washington debated more tax cuts.
item.dc:creator: Maria Elena Vizcaino, Raphael Almeida Dos Santos, Peter Laca, Subhadip Sircar

media:content.media:description: A supporter waves a Romanian flag outside the campaign headquarters of Nicusor Dan. Photographer: Alexandra Corcode/Bloomberg

item.title: Senator Asks SEC to Probe Firms Advising Against JBS Listing
item.description: Kentucky Senator Rand Paul has asked the top US securities regulator to probe two major firms that have advised their clients to vote against a proposed New York listing by JBS SA, the world’s largest meat producer.
item.dc:creator: Gerson Freitas Jr

media:content.media:description: Senator Rand Paul, a Republican from Kentucky and chairman of the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee, during a confirmation hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, Feb. 25, 2025. Troy Edgar, a Navy veteran and former mayor of Los Alamitos, California, served as DHS’s chief financial officer during Trump’s first term, overseeing the department’s more than $90 billion budget and its workforce. Photographer: Kent Nishimura/Bloomberg
